titles.title: To amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that an individual's entitlement to benefits thereunder shall continue through the month of his or her death (without affecting any other person's entitlement to benefits for that month), in order to provide such individual's family with assistance in meeting the extra death-related expenses.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Social Security.

term.name: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

bill.summary: 1/5/1993--Introduced. Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to continue an individual's entitlement to benefits through the month of his or her death with benefits for that month disregarded for purposes of determining maximum family benefits.
